question: Ca Wheel sign is seen in:
exp: In ASOM, the TM appears very red and congested. Since the vessels on the TM run radially this hyperaemic appearance is also known as Ca wheel appearance of TM

question: A 5-year-old child has had eight episodes of acute otitis media in 6 months and has difficulty resolving the effusions between infections. What should be done to effectively eliminate the infections?
exp: Adenoid hyperophy: MC in children Adenoids cause tubal dysfunction by mechanical obstruction of the tubal opening Serous otitis media Long standing collection of serous or mucoid fluid in the middle ear. Causes: Adenoid hyperophy or tumor No pain but hearing loss present (CHL) On examination: - Fluid filled middle ear - Thin bulging TM Management: Medical: decongestant, antihistamines, antibiotics Surgical: -Treatment of causative factor- Adenoidectomy, tonsillectomy and/or wash out of the maxillary antra maybe required. - Myringotomy & drainage of the fluid - Grommet tube inseion in the anteroinferior quadrant.
opa: Continuing treating each infection as it arises
opd: Child should be operated for Adenoidectomy
